website_summaries.verdict: Good price for a scope with plenty of nice features. Lens coating maximizes the transmission of light.
pros: Easy to change settings in the field with click dials
Parallax -free viewing as close as 3 yards
Durable scope that will work well in the field over many hunting trips
cons: May not mount properly to all rifles
Inexpensive parts can't quite match performance of more advanced models

customer_reviews.title: It has legs.
customer_reviews.text: This scope is utter trash. I saw all the great reviews and got suckered yet again. Out of the package it looks nice, but for starters it's going to shoot too low. A mile too low. No problem, just shim it. Here is where the fun part begins. You'll sight it in and it will start shooting one hole groups. Problem solved you think. Wrong, give it a few minutes and go back and now you can't even attain dishplate accuracy at thirty yards it's everywhere. Stay away from this, it's a waste of money. It could have been great, unfortunately it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bodford

customer_reviews.title: Best "tactical" optic under $100 on the market
customer_reviews.text: Really is the best budget optic on the market for under $100. I been using this (I have two now) for over eight years. It has sat atop two 5.56 AR's, a 22WM, and now sits on my 300BO pistol. I have never had an issue with holding zero. The mounts require a little loctit and take some time to get set up, but hold the optic very steady. The illumination doesn't really bring much to the table other than a little better identification during low light, but has a nasty halo at full power. The quick adjustment dials are nice, but definitely not high end. Other all, great starter "tactical" optic for training, plinking, or varmint control.
customer_reviews.author: Big Jim Everard

customer_reviews.title: Bad design flaw - no diopter lockring = no accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: The problem with these scopes is the wobble in the diopter since it has no locking ring to keep it tight - they have updated some of their scopes - but not this one. If you adjust the diopter halfway out - you can wiggle it and that changes your POI (look through the scope as you do this). That's why its all over the place accuracy. Ask me how I know... Send it back - Get a scope version with the diopter lock ring.
customer_reviews.author: K.W.

customer_reviews.title: Pefect for a smaller caliber rifle.
customer_reviews.text: I use bought this scope for an AR 15 but I did not like how it looked and I want a better scope to add to the AR. Instead I use this scope for my .17 Savage. It is a perfect scope for the .17. It is a bright green or red reticle, depending what you prefer or you can just it off very easily to have a black reticle. It is easy to adjust the sight and magnifications and it keeps its zero. I have had great groups the size of a nickle from 50 yards. and a quater size group at 100 years. Very fun to shoot with.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value!
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, I'm skeptical of this Chinese made stuff, but this scope really is punching above its weight class. It really is a sturdy, quality made piece of equipment.. And for 75 bucks, you cant beat the price. Pros: Sturdy and seemingly well made Very clear Adjustable Parallax Locking wind and elevation knobs Small form factor Mounts easily Variable illumination PRICE. Cons: None
customer_reviews.author: QSM

customer_reviews.title: seems to work great for this newbie
customer_reviews.text: I am a NEWBIE, but I really like this scope! My first impression of this, It is Really well made, the finish is nice and it installed easily. I really like how you can adjust the turrets without a tool, then with the provided tool you can move them back to zero. I have bounced this around a bit "playing" with it and it maintains accuracy, i have even swapped it on and off a few times. so far i have to say for $86 i HIGHLY Recommend this scope!
customer_reviews.author: William Clune

customer_reviews.title: Not a good scope
customer_reviews.text: When I got the scope it looked great, mounted it on my AR-15, then used a bore sight to zero it in, 2 days later went to the range to do the final zeroing, at the range I could get it to zero (at 75 yards) but after 3 rounds it would lose its zero, so I tried 5 times with the same thing happening each and every time, so I boxed it back up and sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Whiplash

customer_reviews.title: Major distortion around edges.
customer_reviews.text: This scope is decent for the money. However, I am getting major fishbowl kind of distortion in the image around the outside. I can still hit what I'm aiming at just fine on the crosshairs, and I like how compact this scope is (it's on my 10/22 takedown, and fits fine in the bag). But it's very distracting and not helpful for getting to the target if I'm hunting. I haven't read too much about this in other reviews, so I'm not sure if mine is just out of whack. But I'm not super impressed and don't love using it.
customer_reviews.author: The Danimal

customer_reviews.title: I cant get it adjusted even with different risers.
customer_reviews.text: I had a red dot on my Ar15 but I have always like scopes. So I pulled the trigger after doing alot of research. I mounted with the original scope mount. I could get it adjusted at 50 yards. So I tried 25 yards, the windage adjusted fine. But with the elevation I run out of adjustment and cranking it either way doesnt change it hardly any at all. I tried a different height on the mount with no luck. I would say its defictive. Save your money and buy a better quality. Im going to see if I can get my money back
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Engineering!!!!  lol if your IQ is bigger than YOUR shoe size????? u b da judge....
customer_reviews.text: YOU people had your thinking hats on..... Have Vary expensive optics...Oppppps. Closest dynamics to German tech, BUT MADE IN OUR COUNTRY YAY YAY YAY YAY USA. Hats off to the Briilliant!!! Times are Weird, Keep the Faith- NO MATTER WHAT PLZ........ALLS OK!! Stay areound We Need You. GB
customer_reviews.author: paddy Me Laddy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scope for air rifles
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the scope that came with my .22 Gamo Swarm Maxxim. I did buy an open-box item, so I got a fantastic deal on it. The scope is clear and bright, and the reticle is easy to see, with red or green lighting. It's a far better scope than what I need for my pellet rifle, but I needed something short because the Swarm Maxxim's 10 round magazine limits the length of the scope that will fit. It may be a bit expensive to put on a $180 air rifle, but it works so well with the Swarm Maxxim that I didn't mind spending the money.
customer_reviews.author: expresso96

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: After spending a significant amount of time looking for scopes at or below the $100 range for my new AR 15 (5.56/.223) I found this 3-9x32 BugBuster and plenty of reviews on Amazon as well as YouTube. I decided to jump and I am happy I did. It held up at the range and so far looks good. I took it to the range and sighted it in fairly quickly. My only complaint is about the red/green you do get a slight halo effect when its on full power around the ring but nothing that distorts your actual view, so when I took it to the range I just left it on black or low brightness red.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R

customer_reviews.title: BRWARE, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE! DON'T BUY UTG PRODUCTS
customer_reviews.text: Check out my crooked scope, it was only on my Gamo air rifle for short time. They won't contact me back regarding this issue. Conveniently any extension you try (when you call utg) all say that the mailbox is full. I filled out there online claim also but they won't even talk to me. Beware don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: B & C

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best money I have ever spent in glass.
customer_reviews.text: I go between this and a red dot on my AR... holds zero pretty well with the QD mounts. I would buy again. Update: I was hitting steel plates at 500 yards on a milspec AR with this thing today. SOLID optic 5 stars is not enough. Also it is a second focal plane optic so if you are using the turests or mil dots at less than full magnification you are playing a fools game.
customer_reviews.author: Cummins Guy

customer_reviews.title: bought in 2016
customer_reviews.text: and i have only used it a handful of times since then. that said i took it to the range today to sight it in again. i could not figure out why it would go in and out of focus. then i realized it was turning with every round i fired. how does that even happen? Way too lose, one shot it would be zero then next it would be set to 75. disappointed in scope but it was cheap. maybe a .22lr wouldn't be too big for it. also the red light still worked but the green light no longer does. disappointed in this optic. next time it's red dot for me.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: If you know how to properly mount a scope this is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I read through hundreds of these reviews and sorted them from people who have half a brain and those who shouldn't even own a gun. I took a chance on this and really love it. It's just as good as scopes that are hundreds of dollars more. It fits tightly on your rifle as long as you latch the quick release properly AND TIGHTEN THE SET SCREWS. This scope comes with all the tools necessary. It holds on target well, very adjustable and I'll buy this again if I ever need another.
customer_reviews.author: Karrie Swann

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scope for the price! I held a 1 inch group with this on my M4 at 100m. The only 2 things bad things to say: 1. The scope is too close to my M4, and hard to get behind it properly. This can be fixed with a riser or different scope mounts. 2. This is not a true mildot scope. It has mildest, but when you zoom the optic this mildots are not magnified with the sight picture. This makes the mildots inaccurate at different magnification. This is only an issue for advanced shooters. Other thank those two things, this scope is Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Hudnall

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank on the outside
customer_reviews.text: Will not hold zero. I can not understand why UTG would make a scope that is so durable on the outside and total junk on the inside. I was so disappointed after going to the range and trying to zero this scope at 25 yards. I knew there was a problem when I turned the elevation knob three full rotations and point of impact didn't change. After 150 rounds of .22lr ammo and multiple attempts, I gave up. I sent mine back to Amazon today for a refund. I can't believe Amazon and UTG are dumping this trash on the general public. Avoid at all cost. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ed C

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is exceptional
customer_reviews.text: Well I just got this about 2 weeks now, and it's everything people say it is. Great scope for the money. The rings are a nice height too as the objective lens hovers just a couple mm above my GAS piston handguard. I want to comment more so on the customer service, though.I actually have experience with UTG/leapers customer service for a tactical vest of mine that lost some stitching. I must say, you're in good hands should anything go wrong which really can't be said too much for many companies these days. Would continue shopping UTG/leapers. VERIFIED purchaser.
customer_reviews.author: KUJayhawk

customer_reviews.title: Not the best scope for the money
customer_reviews.text: The optics are not completely crap, but they live right next-door to crap. The optics are made overseas. First of all, the reticles are not at 90° to one another. This has been mentioned by other reviewer‘s. The reticles are approximately 2° off of the 90° I needed it. Secondly, the sites would not zero out. At 100 yards and over 200 rounds, minuscule adjustments led to disastrous results. First Hi then Low. As you should know by now, you get what you pay for. If accuracy is not important to your shooting, then, by all means, BUY THIS SCOPE! I returned mine...
customer_reviews.author: Tony Scocozza

customer_reviews.title: No zero whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these for over two years and have had nothing but problems. I know how to mount a scope and have tested the pellets I use with other rifles, with good scopes, and have come to the conclusion that this scope is not well enough made to handle the recoil of a Gamo Bone Collector or a RWS, Diana, Model 48. The symptoms are as such that I sight one in, and it lasts for two or three shots. At that point I might as well be shooting at a dumpster because there's no way I'll bust a chipmunk, much less a bug. I find myself confused by all the rave reviews on this scope.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to focus on and see reticle.
customer_reviews.text: I found the crosshairs to be almost invisible, because they were too narrow for me, like a hair, even after using the focus at the eyepiece. The mil-dots were too small. I wear trifocals and had to cock my head up to a clear reticle through the reading part of my glasses. I have another UTG scope that had none of these issues. Finding the right eye relief was a problem, too. Maybe it’s better for younger eyes. I didn’t even try to mount it. Perhaps it’s the 32 mm objective. My other UTG scope has a 40 mm objective, and all mil-dots and reticle lines are clear.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Had to send the first one back.
customer_reviews.text: After going through several hundred rounds, I thought I was going crazy. My shots were flying everywhere. Had a buddy shoot it and same result. Returned the scope and was sent a new one in a few weeks. I was told my UTG that they sell millions of these scopes so quality control isn't the best. Thank goodness there is a lifetime warranty. Just keep sending it back until you get a good one! 2nd scope so far is ok. We will see...........
customer_reviews.author: Tamazon

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope, Horrible Mount and Rings
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful scope for the price. If you're on a budget and want something 3-9x32, you can't really beat this product. I was able to zero in within minutes. I love the locking feature once you're zeroed in, which prevents any accidental movement. It held zero perfectly. The only reason I'm giving this 4 stars is because of the rings and mount. It's horrible. I'd highly advise purchasing a different mount and rings. While shooting about 200 rounds, I had to tighten the quick detach lever locks about 4 times. As you shoot, they loosen and they detach from the rail. I'd expect a quick mount to fit without having to tighten a screw, which means bring your allen key.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Are people seriously putting this on AR's?
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews of people putting this on their AR15's and saying it was doing great, I decided to give it a shot. How bad can it be? It looked great on my rifle, but it cannot handle a 300 BLK. It would lose zero as far as 4 inches off at 25 yards within 5 shots. It was promptly returned.
customer_reviews.author: Thatsmeh

customer_reviews.title: Q.C. Issue maybe
customer_reviews.text: Having several other of this same model scope, with which I am very pleased with. I use these for their close range focusing ability and mil dot reticle. The one I just received via this site, had much smaller mil dots that the others of this model scope that I have. The mil dots are so small that they are difficult to discern. The mil dots in my other Bug Busters are very prominent, which is what one wants for a close range scope used for hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Nice smaller 3x9 I've got a lot better ones on bolt action rifles however this scope just works with the AR platform. I wouldn't put a different one on. She definitely groups well at 100 yards. I made some adjustments on this target but my last 5 shots were in the bullseye.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Isker

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve been pleasantly surprised by this little scope that could. I’ve been experimenting with a variety of optics from cheap to expensive and I’m always happy when I find one that is on the less expensive size that does what I want it to do. So far it has held out very well. The magnification level might need some assistance and the view isn’t good enough for competition shooting, but for light hunting and range work this scope has proven surprisingly capable. Currently have it mounted on my AR-10 in .308 and it hasn’t let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Kernes

customer_reviews.title: Image are really blurring unless you look right through the center of the scope
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this newer version of BugBuster is really bad, I have bought similar BugBuster scopes in the past and the old one worked fine; can't say the same thing for these new ones. I bought two of these recently and both scope have really blurry images unless you keep your point of view in a very small center part of scope, I would say 80% the view are blurry, avoid these newer version.
customer_reviews.author: Cheng-Tao Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Scope for first time shooters
customer_reviews.text: Scope install is intuitive and quick but instructions are easy enough. QD attachment makes switching optics a breeze. Maintains zero between optic switches. Use this scope on Ruger PC on 10 - 8 inch targets out to 50-100 yards. Flip up covers and sun shade are a plus for a scope at this price. Parallax and diopter adjustments and multiple brightness levels are a plus for aging vision. *warranty policy is outstanding. Damaged parts are shipped immediately. Just fill out form with manufacturer online.
customer_reviews.author: cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy i put on my AK47 reticle was ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy i put on my AK47 reticle was crooked illumination would cut on and off after i took a shot. I purchased two scopes both had same problems on two different ak47s
customer_reviews.author: trenel

customer_reviews.title: Entry level at best
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am happy with the scope, it sighted in fairly easy and has held up to 5.56 62gr ammo over 200 rnds. This in my opinion is probably best on a small caliber/low recoiling rifle that you plan to use for distances shorter than 75 yards. The eye relief is ok, but not what you would get out of a scope that is 50$ more. I might move it over to my .22lr rifle and I think it would be amazing for something like that, but on .223 or 5.56 it is just fair at best anything higher caliber than that and I think you would be really disappointed. Functional but nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Mixted

customer_reviews.title: Quality optic for a good price!!!
customer_reviews.text: As a retired Infantryman I was spoiled with the level of tactical equipment I was issued and I had no idea how much things cost! I have stayed away from UTG because of the low price point, I assumed that lack of $$$ equated to lack of quality, I could not have been more wrong. This optic is more than you pay for and it is more than the average person will need. It's very well built, easy to mount and I have stopped overlooking UTG products!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Silverback

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I read about tilted reticle thing and my opinion is that most likely the scopes were not installed and leveled correctly. I had no problems with this. Scope looks well made. Everything seems to be of good quality on this scope for the money . I paid 67$ with free shipping. I am going to use it on my ar15. I got it for the purpose of shooting out to 50-200 yards. The QD scope rings are nice as well I may use a riser so I can still keep my BUIS mounted. I will update this review after I get rounds down range.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Connors

customer_reviews.title: Best scope in 40 yrs of hunting
customer_reviews.text: After researching 3 weeks and all the reviews I decided on this scope for my AM15. Most people complained about the reticle not being centered. Not the case for me. This scope is amazing, amazing eye relief at 3 or 9 and everything is super clear. One of the best scopes I've had in 40 years.
customer_reviews.author: Adam beaty

customer_reviews.title: Best Scope I Have Ever Used!
customer_reviews.text: For about $80, you can get this scope and it is worth every penny. It is easy to mount, easy to adjust and holds it's zero settings without having to reset them constantly. From the box to the zero shot takes about 10 min. or less. I use it on pellet guns and also my other rifles. With a Benjamin Nitro Piston break barrel .177 cal pellet gun, I can see and hit a target the size of a quarter (approx. 1") at 50 yards using H&N Barracuda Extreme HP Pellets. Buy this scope for every gun you own. You will love it and enjoy it on every outing. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Drummer24

customer_reviews.title: Varmint buster!
customer_reviews.text: So I have bought a few of these scopes and have used them on various rifles. All mine work great! They hold zero fine. I crank them to 9x to sight in and usually keep them around 4x. Bullet goes right where I'm aiming. I put one on my Ruger Ranch in .450 Bushmaster, sighted it in in the spring time, took it out last week and fired six shots all on the money at 100 yards. Has held zero perfectly. My Ruger 10/22 its the same story. These scopes are the best you can get for the money hands down.
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic product for the price. Very well made, and does everything scopes costing many times more will do. Plus comes with all the extra stuff you'd have to pay more to buy with a high-end scope. I have some high-end scopes too, but this one compares favorably. The only issue is durability, and that remains to be seen. But for most of us, our lives don't depend on our scopes, so it's worth it to take a chance on something in this price range, to me. Have since ordered another one... and it probably won't be my last. A big fan!
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Fits in case
customer_reviews.text: When the standard length Nikon scope would not allow me to put the stock section of my 10/22TD back in the case, I started looking for a shorter scope. This one fits and allows me to put it back in without removing the scope. This reduces hassle and there is less chance of losing zero by removing and remounting scope. The only downside, is that the case puts a lot of pressure on the flip cover on the front optic so it pops open when I pull it out. It was easy to sight in and seems to hold zero, but I need to use it more to be sure it will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: TLS, OTD

customer_reviews.title: Zero won't hold
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I tried to sight this thing in with a Laser boresighter. Every time I'd put in the boresighter and slap the paddle, the dot would be in a different spot every time. I even tightened the lock nuts as tight as I could get with my hands. At first I thought it was my boresighter, but I have another rifle with iron sights, and it's lined up every time with that one, I also took a few shots @ 50 yards with this thing thinking it's sighted in and missed every shot. There's something definitely wrong with this thing, not saying all of them are like that, but this one here definitely doesn't hold zero
customer_reviews.author: Terrell Pennywell

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Can’t speak for accuracy quite yet but I’m pretty positive I won’t be let down. Mounted up like a champ on the 10/22 and the dial for going between green and red with brightness thrown in is straight up $$$ ORDER UPDATE: fantastic little scope. Got it out to the range, and with a few simple adjustments it was good to go. Groups the size of a blueberry
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Do your homework
customer_reviews.text: The rings don’t co-witness on an AR. The scope won’t fit standard one piece mounts...not enough space between turrets for this. Lens is cloudy, illumination is blurry. Returned and bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: Antique Future

customer_reviews.title: The quick detach mounts are awesome, I can swap my go to reflex sigh ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this optic on my DPMS. I hear people saying you can't have back up sights. Yes you can. I have this mounted one ring on my flat top and the other on my quad rail. works perfectly as advertised and the eye relief will surprise you. I would venture to say that you can all most use this as a reflex sight at 3X. I also have the UTG swat 4-12 and it has held up on my .308 savage no problems. there is a reason why it has all most 1500 reviews. The quick detach mounts are awesome, I can swap my go to reflex sigh (sightmark BTW) t and slap this on with zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price! Great even, for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap! It works on my AR-10 as advertised. So far it hasn't done anything strange and holds true after about 100 rounds. I feel it was a good buy although I have much better scopes I prefer... But at this price I do like it and endorse the product. I would buy another, especially for a mid range shooter like the smaller AR-15 in 5.56 because that's where this would really shine. My . 308 is pushing it and will probably ruin it eventually, that's my opinion anyways.
customer_reviews.author: K. R.

customer_reviews.title: A good budget-friendly optic
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this on a .22 caliber Benjamin Marauder air pistol. It'll give me inch groups at 25 yards with no issue if I do my part. Optical quality is decent, and given the price point, I was pleasantly surprised. The included scope caps were a nice touch. This would readily be at home on any PCP airgun, rimfire rifles, or smaller caliber centerfire rifles as long as you're not trying to get tremendous distances.
customer_reviews.author: KOB

customer_reviews.title: A step down from other UTG models
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to grade this too harshly, based on my own misunderstanding. But be aware that although this is an adjustable objective scope, that is not an AO knob on the side of it. That's a round electrical control for the lighting. It's a fair scope for it's intended purpose, but it is a significant step down from the UTG 30mm (SWAT, etc) models. Smaller tube, less convenient adjustment, smaller optics. If those things meet your requirements, it may be a great choice for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Buy One, fantastic optic for the price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So I was reluctant to buy this scope. But after a month of thinking about it I pulled the trigger and bought one, and boy am I glad I did. This optic is extremely well built, clear glass, awesome features and holds true to zero as long a shot your not abusing your rifle. I do suggest loctite on all screws and bolts. Buy one, you won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good scope, great price
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't getting overly excited for this optic as I was expecting some flaws based on other reviews. Overall I am pretty happy with this scope, but for the price it was actually a really good deal. Going to have to put some thread lock on the tension screws for the QD rings, as they became loose after 50 rounds down range. Biggest complaint is the read and green reticle seem to be off a hair compared to the etched in reticle, not a huge issue since I don't plan on using the feature.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Holds zero 100%, fantastic customer support.
customer_reviews.text: Zeroed quickly and easily, has held zero perfectly after several hundred rounds through an AR. Tons of features you can't find on a scope for less than double the price of this one. Accidentally dropped the rifle with the scope on it onto a tile floor. Scope didn't lose zero or shift at all. Beat up the battery door a little but Leapers ended up replacing that for free after I explained what happened. Very happy customer, I have bought their stuff in the past but after this will definitely do so in the future.
customer_reviews.author: STS-135

customer_reviews.title: Not built to hold up to a springer air rifle
customer_reviews.text: The recoil from my 1400 cs air rifle froze the adjustments on this scope after about 45 shots
customer_reviews.author: james d. ollom

customer_reviews.title: Nice scope for the money...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an OEM scope with this one on my break barrel air rifle. Only complaint is the battery does not last long. I've gotten to the point where I don't use the color reticle because the battery is usually dead. It comes with 2 batteries and now I know why. Other then that I like the scope - it's accurate, is easy to zero, holds its focus and the AO seems to work as it supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and Compact Scope for your Air gun.
customer_reviews.text: Great scope but the lighted cross hairs were a little overkill for me and the scope has more than enough light entry in low light conditions. The scope is rugged compared to the stock scope that came with my Gamo Varmit. The scope will fit on the Gamo 11 mm dovetail mount rings but the front dust cover has to be removed. To solve this, screw on the sunshade, then put the dust cover over it. But be aware that the quick detach won't work. However, you can always buy inexpensive Picatinny or Weaver mounts that will fit the dovetails.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Duvall

customer_reviews.title: Leapers UTG succeeds again
customer_reviews.text: UTG never seems to disappoint me. I own several of their accessories and am always pleased with their products. The optic has very crisp lens'. The clarity is better than what I was expecting. The mounting setup is sturdy and easy to reattach. From my limited testing so far it retains zero. I use this on my AR15 and my sks. I'll be buying a secondly shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth twice the price
customer_reviews.text: This scope has really surprised me for the price (around $80) Clear field of view, red or green cross-hairs very pronounced. Has a locking system for holding zero. Holds zero better that any other scope I've used for this price-point. Buy this scope, the price is going up because the word is out!
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope
customer_reviews.text: I love the scope for everything except that the batteries won’t hold a charge more than a few weeks. I’ve had the scope about 7 weeks and have gone through 3 batteries. This is with ensuring it is in off position when done using. I should point out that this is with maybe 2-3 hours of actual usage. I’ve tried contacting manufacturer to no avail I raised my stars because Amazon replaced and second one worked great. Comments about manufacturers lack of response is still valid. Awful
customer_reviews.author: JC III

customer_reviews.title: 4.8 Stars. Only one thing I would change.
customer_reviews.text: Great scope! Clear optic. Extremely easy to sight in and dials are "in tune" when making adjustments. Illuminated reticle is a great feature for low light conditions. True there is about 3" of eye relief which is plenty for plinking and varmit hunting. Mounted on Smith & Wesson M&P 15/22 so not worried about it holding zero since there is little felt recoil. Only thing I'd change is that the front dust cover be made compatible with the sun shade; it still fits but not snug like it is without the sun shade. Overall great especially for the price! I would purchase this again no doubt and recommend to anyone looking for a solid budget scope.
customer_reviews.author: Arex

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the price! A definite rebuy!
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this scope on my AR platform. Shooting a .223 HPBT round. It mounted very easy with the quick release mounts. I really like that they are adjustable so you can get them pretty tight. Once in the field it zeroed in pretty fast! I shot 21 rounds in 3 round groups to get the group shown in the pic at 100 yards. I really like that the cross hairs light up in 2 different colors but you can still use it with no color! And the colors dim down to almost nothing. I bought this to replace a red dot sight and couldn’t be happier! One of the best scopes I’ve purchased for around a $100
customer_reviews.author: Msteele

customer_reviews.title: Mil-Dots, AO, illuminated
customer_reviews.text: Great scope with good features. I am new to the air rifle world and wanted a better than stock scope with AO and Mil-Dots and got illuminated sights as a bonus for a great price. Optics are great no issue with quality from what can t tell. But I'm not the most experienced with optics anyway. Will update review as time goes on. Only con is the scope rings. They have a rounded bumper or stop on the bottem that fits the picatinny rail. So if you don't tighten them down enough they creep and damage the rail. Paired on my Gamo Swarm Maxxim .22, with a UTG Dovetail to Picatinny rail adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Nate B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scope
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my M&P 15-22. Didn't want to go all out for my plinking and critter shooting gun so I read the reviews here and ordered it. Have to say I'm delighted with the scope. Holds zero fine, nice tactile clicks on the knobs, clear sight picture, seems pretty tough. Not sure id deploy with it but for hunting and plinking it's great. The illuminated reticle is a nice feature, especially when using with a flashlight attachment at night. I give it a five stars because it exceeded what I expected for the price. Happy customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but made a good match for the 7
customer_reviews.text: This is my beat up scope for a MAS 1949, MAS 1949/56, and a MAS 1936.  I accidentally discovered that it was not only tough, but made a good match for the 7.5x54mm round. The scope is big, easy to use, handles light well, and is a natural pointer. Well healed shooters with bottomless wallets will laugh at you as they swing around their thousand dollar optics on two thousand dollar M14s., but you will get to chuckle when they lament their hopelessly mud jammed Springfield action with scratched optics while your bugbuster's simpler but more rugged glass and your 400 buck rifle is still pushing ammo down range.
customer_reviews.author: S. N. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Reticle works great
customer_reviews.text: At first the quick mount levers loosened up and the rounds were going all over the place. When I figured out that the quick mount levers could be adjusted by tightening the allen screw on the quick mount lever things got a LOT better. Easily zeroed using CCI 22LR Mini Mags at 100 yards. At 50 yards aiming about 1.25 bars (not dots) high put me right on target. At 25 yards aiming 1 bar high put me right on target again. At 200 yards I was hitting the paper by aiming 3 dots (not bars) high. Very nice little scope.
customer_reviews.author: OTTO

customer_reviews.title: Price Equals Quality.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for the quality and clarity of an expensive Vortex, Nightforce, or Schmidt & Bender this scope is not it. However, if you are looking for a decent quality scope at a reasonable price this scope fits the bill. It sits well on an AR style weapon, and is good from a bench rest out to about 100 yards. Some hard core shooters will use it for greater ranges. Watch out for the “O” ring gasket for the battery cap. If you tighten it too much it will pop out.
customer_reviews.author: T. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 10/22 takedown
customer_reviews.text: Got this scope for a 10/22 takedown , it will fit into the bag while fitted to the rifle so you don't have to take it on and off , the optic is quite clear and adjustments are fairly precise , zeroed in about 20 shots , I think it's a good optic for the price and suits my needs well , comes with 2 batteries for the illumination , cleaning cloth , sun shade , 2 flip caps , 2qd rings and all needed Allen keys .
customer_reviews.author: Hampster

customer_reviews.title: Spot on
customer_reviews.text: I do not have anything bad to say about this scope besides the fact that it does not come leveled in the mounting rings. The lens are crisp and not foggy. The option to change the reticle to green and red is seamless. Even if the battery dies the scope can be used as normal. Took about 3 minutes to install and another 5 to get sighted in. So had have put a couple hundred rounds through my 223 and still holds zero. Best scope I have used for under 100 bucks. I would recommend to anyone that is looking for a cheaper, reliable, rifle scope.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dollar
customer_reviews.text: So review so far is for day 1, receiving and mounting. Have yet to fire it. First impressions are quite good. Solid build, durable, clear. Mounting was fairly straightforward forward and simple. Reticle illumination is adjustable and very sharp. Not blurry, faded or misaligned. Once attached to my rail it seems very sturdy. Shall see what happens when I take it the range to zero, but for right now I'd say its money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: It’s awesome...
customer_reviews.text: Highly accurate and holds its zero, I dropped it after sighting it in and it was still on point. And the red and green illumination is very bright but also has on option to lower the brightness which is nice, as well as being able to turn the illumination on and off. The battery it takes is a 1620
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Plinker
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't want to try a shot further out than about 100 yards but within that range this is a good value little plinking scope. After playing around with it and adjusting it ( It's very adjustable,) I was quite happy with it's relatively close range accuracy and the eye relief is decent, not as good as a higher end scope but good for the money. If you want to save a little dough and get a decent scope you'll like this scope.
customer_reviews.author: Because I told you!

customer_reviews.title: No zero
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this scope. Based on the overwhelmingly good reviews I took the chance on it but after a day at the range and the reticle maxed out to the right the closest I could get to "zeroed" was about 18 inches to the left of center. Frustrating day and waste of ammo. I thought about exchanging it for another that may work but I think I'll just spend the money on a better scope. Thanks to Amazon for the great return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob-o

customer_reviews.title: Works well at 100 yards
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this scope. I took it out to the range and was able to zero it fairly easily and comfortably hit my target at 100 yards. I did have to install a 1 inch riser due to my front sights but installation and set up was pretty simple. Should I run into any issues I'll update this post but for the time being I'm satisfied with this product. P.S. I've had no need for the illumination feature thus far but I can see the applications in a hunting environment or when shooting outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely incredible scope for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For under $100, this is an unbelievable value. The eye relief is beyond generous, sight picture is crisp, and it comes with QD mounts and flip up covers included, plus an illuminated reticle! I actually like the sight picture more than in my Vortex (which doesn’t come with mounts or flip up covers). An absolutely incredible value.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V.

customer_reviews.title: Scope is good but mounting is lacking for .22
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit right on a .22 Ruger American Rimfire immediately. I am only able to use 1 mounting ring, because the scope is not long enough. Weirdly I can't post a picture. Had to also buy the Evolution Gun Works EGW Scope Base Ruger American Rimfire Picatinny Rail to be able to use both rings. Now is great.
customer_reviews.author: DarthUnderhill

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and handles heavy recoil
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these mounted on a 6.5 Grendel and a 450 Bushmaster. Mount is solid and the scope has been durable so far. Over 200 rounds through the Grendel and 250 rounds of 260 grain @2200 fps through the bushmaster with no problems. And the bushmaster recoils hard, no muzzle brake on it (yet). The scope is handling the recoil better than my shoulder and cheek and delivering 1" or better groups. Turrets are easy to zero/adjust and lighted reticle is crisp and bright. For the price, I don't know how you could do better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rugged sporting scope with great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and well constructed scope. All of the construction is very precise and of a high quality including the mount. If you want a rugged scope for an AR or other sporting rifle then I would recommend this one. With all that said I found the mount to be too low and purchased a riser (also UTG) to make it more comfortable to use. You also must keep in mind that the UTG is a value item and it does not have the "optics" of say a Vortex or a Leopold - that is to say the the detail you see of the target is not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scope!
customer_reviews.text: All the features of this scope I am very satisfied with. This thing includes the ability to get a crystal clear focus and the green or red aluminate crosshairs if desired. Comes with two batteries for the scope one as a backup. The only issue is with the mounting brackets. I was using this scope on a Gamo Whisper .177 air rifle. The mounting brackets were too large for the air rifle. However was able to utilize the air rifles brackets that came with the Gamo Whisper .177. If needed probably could've purchased an adapter for the rifle's scope mount.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on my M&P 15-22
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for your buck! Sighted in easy and holds zero and I love the qd rings. Works perfect on my .22lr but may be a little sketchy on something higher caliber but perfect for my plinkster
customer_reviews.author: W Jaxson

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope; Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a mil-dot scope for use on my GAMO Swarm Maxxim air rifle and my research pointed to UTG. You can read all the specs online and watch the review videos but let me add: this is a great scope at a really good price. After seeing how well it worked with my GAMO, I bought another one (before the price goes up) to place on the PCP air rifle that I am saving up for.
customer_reviews.author: MWCraft

customer_reviews.title: Cannot zero vertically
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The build is good. Looks well made. Cons: The furthest I could take it was 2 notches below center. I really wanted to like this thing. It really seems to match my rifle, but in practicality, is this even supposed to be used in the AR platform or is it just for Airsoft? Either way, I'm returning it and trying something else.
customer_reviews.author: H.M. ElMostrito

customer_reviews.title: Wont hold zero. Must have a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any luck with this on my 10/22 I set it I tighten down the turrets and it moves inches off zero. if I leave them loose I can get closer. But its still bouncing around. Its seems to have gotten worse over time I thought it was the fault of my take down, but I have not taken it apart. I will get a hold of UTG and see how they handle it. But a gun that wont shoot straight is a worthless gun to me I dont like to wound animals, not even the pest in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Motorcitymadman

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just to see what it would be like kn my 556 ar. Surprisingly it has held up and has been on target. I've only out 1-200 rounds down range with it but it's been working well. The illumination could be more crisp as in less blurry but it is still very good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good looking easy to mount scope
customer_reviews.text: Nice scope with great features. Super easy to mount, looks sweet on my Ruger PC Carbine, and I can’t wait to go give it a try during my next target practice.
customer_reviews.author: Inked_girl

customer_reviews.title: Great scope!
customer_reviews.text: Love this so far. Great scope for the price! I'd recommend it to anyone with an AR-15 or 10 you can hit a 100yrds clean and easy also the added red and green site if you dont feel like using black. I like how you dont have to use an allen wreck to take it off if you want to change out your scope at the range.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin & Amanda Rogers

customer_reviews.title: UTG vs Leopold, Bushnell, Vortex
customer_reviews.text: Have this on my ruger 10/22 and I love it! Pros: lightweight for being illuminated Easy to mount Clear Adjustable turrets that actually work Parallax adjustment down to 3 yards! Cons: No option of not being illuminated Knobs can be hard to turn at first I'm a UTG fanboy, but for good reason. They just work! Great quality and precision for anything under 300$
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C

customer_reviews.title: Mounts too low, some bleed out of illumination
customer_reviews.text: Scope is very clear and bright, reticle is crisp. The included mounts are very low, not even usable for mounting to AR rails. The reticle appears to have a very slight cant of maybe 2 or 3 degrees when leveled using a scope leveling system. Illumination on both colors can be adjusted in brightness from almost imperceptible to washed out bright, even in daylight. The illumination does bleed out quite a bit into the bottom right of the scope from 3 to 6 o'clock. It remains to be seen if the adjustments track while sighting in and hold under use.
customer_reviews.author: x_count

customer_reviews.title: Good little scope but poor eye relief.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this on a Benjamin Vaporizer .22 and it does the job. It's accurate, holds zero and light weight. Lighted crosshairs are kind of useless but nice to have I guess. As other mentioned when using sunshade you can't have the front lens cap on (kinda sucks). My big negative with this is since is a very compact scope the eye relief is kind of horrible, but you have to expect that with such a short tube.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Averill

customer_reviews.title: not a bad air rifle scope
customer_reviews.text: I haven't mounted it yet, but for the money, not a bad air rifle scope. Made in China too, and they are stepping up in quality. Appears well made and durable. Not as clear and crisp as a Nikon, but ok for airgun pest control. Far better than the quality of many other Chinese made airgun scopes often included with package deals, gun / scope combos.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my crosman nitro venom .22 air rifle. A couple things... Getting it mounted so that reticule was level was a challenge...the quick disconnects must be mounted very securely before scope mounting or it will cause scope tube to twist and not line up properly. The lockouts rings.... They work great, but they can drift for the first 2-6 shots. Be patient, and don't be tempted to run with them unlocked. The optics are better than expected for money. The objective lens cap doesn't fit very well with sunshade installed. Boohoo. I'm shooting quarter size targets at 65yards, pretty darn consistently. With an air rifle. I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: sk33t

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly diopter adjustment renders scope useless
customer_reviews.text: The diopter adjustment is wobbly, which changes POI dramatically... Basically renders the scope useless... Once the diopter adjusted, I used duct tape to keep it from wobbling but still moves enough to cause significant change in POI. I'll try a few drops of glue... but that will be the end of diopter adjustment... It's a shame, because otherwise seems like a good scope...
customer_reviews.author: Dorin

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope
customer_reviews.text: Talk about bang for the buck "Bugbuster" delivers for me! Zero in's w/o issue. Holds zero when shooting (shot approximately 600 rds with it on 9mm rifle). Holds zero after removing scope with QR rings (removed 2x) Red/Green Dual Illumination works great. Daytime reticle very good. Lens cover caps are good quality but move when you turn power or adjust optics. No issues, No misaligned reticle with mine. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: folklore

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope Without Breaking the Bank
customer_reviews.text: After you follow the directions utilizing the UTG video about centering the crosshairs within the reticle you’ve got a solid and inexpensive scope. It kept zero through over 100 rounds with a scope picture with a pistol target at over 80 yards. I know that’s not much, but it was accurate considering that I don’t have the steadiest of shooting abilities. Can’t afford that ultra high quality scope then consider this one as a prime option.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger 4

customer_reviews.title: Won't Sight in
customer_reviews.text: This scope is meant to be mounted on a Picatinny. If you get something like a Crosman Fire Nitro Piston Air Rifle, you will need extra hardware. I've sighted in many scopes in my life, but this one won't even come close. Each shot is totally unpredictable. Not sure what is going on.
customer_reviews.author: RealReviewCalifornia

customer_reviews.title: Terrific scope value
customer_reviews.text: Scopes are sort of a personal thing, what works well for one person might not work for another but for me these scope are great. Its compact size allows for applications across a broad range of installs. The adjustable knob positions make holding zero super simple and the lockable knob feature means that you can set it and forget it and never worry about knocking it out of adjustment. The accessories it comes with were a big value as well. It has a big brother which is the 3-12x44 whci is also great.
customer_reviews.author: Lee K

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. The cross hairs are much too thick and adjustment knobs are too tight to turn. The battery cover and lumination adjustment o ring does not even fit! Very diassapointed. I have the larger version of very similar scope and I really like it, but this one is no anything like the other utg scope.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I'm simply not willing to spend a ton of money on optics. I'm not a competition shooter or a hunter. I have an AK and a Kel-Tec RFB, so I'm not exactly into precision shooting. I looked at a ton of options and settled on this for my Kel-Tec RFB and have really enjoyed it. I've taken it out four or so times and haven't had any problems. Good scope for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Manzella

customer_reviews.title: This a a Best Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This a a Best Buy ! It comes with quick release rings, caps and a sun shade all for around 90 bucks, great deal. I got this for a Ruger 10/22 Take Down. I was looking for a scope I could leave mounted when putting in the bag, according to Utube this would fit and it does. I've had it at the range twice, it zeroed easily and so far has stayed zeroed. BTW it looks Bad A.. too. Perfect for range and plinking. Nothing bad to say about it, clear, crisp sight window, very impressed at this price point. I'll update if anything goes awry, but very satisfied at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Educated Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer be ware!!!
customer_reviews.text: this product was a disappointment form the moment it was placed on my door step. it was advertised as rifle scope. its not its an airsoft scope. it was advertised as coming with a rail mounting system. it does however the system included is one of the cheapest peices of junk ive ever seen. this actually never made it onto my rifle due to the obvious low quality. i was expecting more but will never again buy a UTG product for my rifles.
customer_reviews.author: Michael j Dagar

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate scope , easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it , love it . im so happy with. The choice i made. If u r looking for a good scope and a great price i highly recommend buying. The utg bug buster scope once u get it zeroed in. Your good to go. I will be buying another one soon for my second rifle. Happy shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Samaripa

customer_reviews.title: Good performance on a break-barrel.22 pellet gun.
customer_reviews.text: For varmint control out to 30 yards with a break-barrel .22 pellet gun, this gets the job done. Clear optics with mil dot, it hits with accuracy close-in, and out to the end of my garden at 30 yards.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stilwell

customer_reviews.title: Nice little scope
customer_reviews.text: Topped my Ruger 10/22 build with this thing and I really like it. The red and green settings are crisp and bright, so far it has held its zero when taking it on and off. When zeroing the adjustments were easy and the adjustment knobs were very positive. The zoom worked great and the optic feels very solid overall. Not sure that I would trust it on something other than my .22 but I am not sure that I wouldn't...cannot wait to get it out and shoot with it more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value delivered w this Scope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a pellet gun. I love it. I like being able to adjust the scope without screwing covers off and using a screw driver...that protocol is a time waster. Favorites....It's clear, bright, red and green crosshairs, dot cross hairs for compensation and short in length. The quick release mount is really nice too. Expectations exceeded. First UTG purchase...would buy something else from them in the future...so many companies with similar products out there....nice to find quality. Someone really thought about the design of this scope and created a great feature package for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your time or rounds
customer_reviews.text: Could not hold a zero. Used a vice to hold the weapon and POI would move around between 3-8 inches. Parallax adjustment would move on its own while shooting and after about 10 rounds it would move from infinity to about 25 yds. Returning it after wasting about 300 rounds.
customer_reviews.author: Larry L Jackson Jr

product_meta.title: UTG 3-9X32 1" BugBuster Scope, AO, RGB Mil-dot, QD Rings
product_meta.description:
UTG 3-9X32 Compact CQB Bug Buster AO RGB Scope UTG 3-9X32 1" BugBuster Scope, AO, RGB Mil-dot, QD Rings 
SCP-M392AOLWQ
The UTG 3-9x32 Bug Buster scope is completely sealed and 100% nitrogen filled. It is shock, fog, and rain proof for maximum reliability when mounted on your firearm or airgun application. Dual red and green illumination and an accommodating eye relief makes this scope a no brainer for all shooters who find themselves in the most diverse of environments and weather conditions. Standard for the SCP-M392AOLWQ is the included 2” sunshade, quality flip-open lens caps, and quick detachable rings. This 3-9X32 Bug Buster is ready to meet your shooting needs right out of the box.

True Strength Platform 
The innovative True Strength(TS) Platform is a signature scope construction platform. Most significantly, it includes a Smart Spherical Structure(SSS) controlling the joint-like interaction between a scope’s inner and outer tubes. The design provides long lasting reliability in these interactions to guarantee precise and responsive windage/elevation adjustment over time. TS has been at the heart of every genuine Leapers scope for more than a decade and has been fully tested on scope-killer airguns and elephant rifles with extreme recoil.

Most Demanding Tests 
We perform our testing based on actual users' input. We gather usage intelligence from all deployment aspects, carefully analyze their impacts and develop appropriate test parameters to ensure optimal performance under all conditions. TS has been at the heart of every genuine Leapers scope for more than a decade and has been fully tested on scope-killer airguns and elephant rifles with extreme recoil.

Premium Lockable and Resettable Turrets 
Well-designed and constructed target turrets allow for crisp, consistent and precise windage and elevation adjustments. Its locking and re-setting features protect and complement one of the most critical parts in the optic for proper zeroing.

Parallax Free View from 3 Yards to Infinity 
Uncommon throughout the market, this particular scope series achieves an impressive and unparalleled parallax free view from as close in as 3 yards out to infinity using its adjustable wide angle front objective.

RGB Side Wheel Illumination 
Leapers/UTG pioneered red AND green reticle illumination in this industry in 2004, allowing for even more effective scope use under diverse environments and lighting conditions. The innovative side wheel control was then introduced for the RGB illumination, getting away from the traditional bulky rheostat on the eye piece and giving users quick and easy access for reticle light.

Range Estimating Mil-dot Reticle 
Leapers/UTG started introducing mil-dot reticle optics from as early as 2003, pioneering the Range Estimating concept as a useful tool for hunters and shooters around the world. Today, the mil-dot reticle is widely accepted and used in this industry. Leveraging our years of experience in this area, UTG developed and refined the unique Tactical Range Estimating(TRE) mil-dot reticle and offers this feature in almost all of our optics. With some patient learning and practice using our TRE, shooters can enhance accuracy and performance in ways not imagined before. Regular mil-dot reticles found on the market usually have 4 dots in each direction of the cross hair, giving you 9 different aiming points for either windage or elevation. If you count the 2 inner tips of the opposite duplex cross hairs, you get 11 aiming points. In contrast, Leapers/UTG 36 Mil-Dot Tactical Range Estimating Reticle (TRE) has 9 dots on each direction of the cross hair, giving you 19 aiming points or 21 including the inner tips of the duplex cross hairs.

Accessories 
UTG aims to provide application and solution oriented products, including useful and most commonly sough-after accessories. In addition to the flip-open lens caps, a 2” sunshade and a pair of medium profile Max Strength heavy duty rings are included. The rings, with a saddle height of 15mm, fit on Picatinny/Weaver rails and are secured with patented, fully adjustable quick detach lever locks.
feature_bullets: BEWARE OF COUNTERFEIT PRODUCTS SHIPPED DIRECTLY FROM CHINA
Range Estimating Mil-dot Reticle for Optimal Aiming and Shooting Performance, Adjustable Objective from 3 Yards to Infinity
Red/Green Dual Illumination for Versatile Applications, Large Field of View and Most Accommodating Eye Relief for Optimum Critical CQB Mission
Complete with 2" Sunshade, High Quality Flip-open Lens Caps and Quick-detachable Rings
Built on True Strength Platform, Completely Sealed and Nitrogen Filled, Shockproof, Fog proof and Rainproof
1 Inch Tube with Emerald Coating for Maximum Light Transmission, Premium Zero Lockable & Resettable Turrets with 1/4 MOA Per Click Adjustment

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
